newsitem.title: GERMANY: Grundig to survive despite losses - CEO.
newsitem.headline: Grundig to survive despite losses - CEO.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV's lossmaking German unit Grundig AG should survive despite heavy losses and the closure of one of its main plants, Grundig chief executive Pieter van der Wal said on Monday.
Van der Wal, speaking to 3,500 workers in Nuremberg, said that through innovation and maintaining sufficient capacity Grundig would be able to continue as an independent brand.

Grundig, best known for its televisions and videorecorders, plans to close its iR3 video plant in Nuremberg. But Van der Wal said he wanted to keep the Nuremberg-Langwasser assembly plant open and add new production there.
Grundig lost a record 600 million marks last year.
